message_1: What is the amount of energy released in a nuclear fusion reaction where 5 grams of hydrogen are converted into helium? Assume that the efficiency of the reaction is 0.7 and the energy equivalent to one gram of matter is 9 x 10^13 joules.
message_2:
To find the amount of energy released in the nuclear fusion reaction, we can use the following formula:

Energy released = (mass of hydrogen converted) × (energy equivalent per gram) × (efficiency of the reaction)

Given:
Mass of hydrogen converted = 5 grams
Energy equivalent per gram = 9 x 10^13 joules
Efficiency of the reaction = 0.7

Energy released = (5 grams) × (9 x 10^13 joules/gram) × (0.7)

Energy released = 5 × 9 x 10^13 × 0.7 joules

Energy released = 31.5 x 10^13 joules

Energy released = 3.15 x 10^14 joules

So, the amount of energy released in the nuclear fusion reaction is 3.15 x 10^14 joules.
